intro: Brachystele bracteosa, commonly known as the narrow-leaved moss-rose, is a species of flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Aizoaceae, also known as the ice plant family, and is characterized by its succulent, fleshy leaves. The plant produces small, star-shaped flowers in shades of pink and yellow, typically blooming in spring. It thrives in well-drained, sandy soils and is often found in rocky or coastal areas. Due to its unique appearance and adaptability, it is a popular choice for rock gardens and xeriscaping.
